brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to see if staggering doses of nelfinavir, ritonavir, and
      saquinavir has any effect on the interactions between these drugs.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Staggered Dosing on Interactions Between Paired Combinations of Nelfinavir, Ritonavir, and Saquinavir

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria

        Patients must have:

          -  Absence of HIV-1 infection as documented by any licensed ELISA test kit within 14
             days prior to study entry.

        Exclusion Criteria

        Co-existing Condition:

        Patients with the following symptoms and conditions are excluded:

          -  Any medical condition that, in the opinion of the investigator, would interfere with
             the patient's ability to participate in this protocol.

        Patients with the following prior conditions and symptoms are excluded:

          -  History of chronic illness such as hypertension, coronary artery disease, arthritis,
             diabetes, or any chronic gastrointestinal conditions that might interfere with drug
             absorption.

clinical_study.official_title: A Prototype Study to Test the Effect of Staggered Dosing on the Pharmacokinetic Interactions Between Paired Combinations of Nelfinavir (NFV), Ritonavir (RTV), and Soft Gelatin Capsule of Saquinavir (SQVsgc)

reference.citation: Washington CB, Flexner C, Sheiner LB, Rosenkranz SL, Segal Y, Aberg JA, Blaschke TF; AIDS Clinical Trials Group Protocol (ACTG 378) Study Team. Effect of simultaneous versus staggered dosing on pharmacokinetic interactions of protease inhibitors. Clin Pharmacol Ther. 2003 May;73(5):406-16.
